title: Public opinion on the most important problem facing the U.S. 2020
summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and lowest at Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
There is a difference of 26.0 between the maximum Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and minimum Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and lowest at Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and lowest at Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
There is a difference of 26.0 between the maximum Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and minimum Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
max_summary: This bar chart has 16 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and lowest at Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Response Healthcare.
The highest Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership has 26.0 more Share of respondents than the lowest Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.

The Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership has the highest Share of respondents, followed by Healthcare, and Healthcare. Down to the Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS which is the lowest.

Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS, Foreign policy/Foreign aid/Focus overseas, Economy in general, Guns/Gun control, Gap between rich and poor, Education, and Wars/War (nonspecific)/Fear of war have a similar Share of respondents that is 2.0.
The highest value 28.0 at Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership is almost 5.6 times larger than the average value 5.0.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 80.0.

data.Response: Lack of respect for each other
